assignmentSubmission.title: Assignment Submission
assignmentSubmission.instructionsP1: There is an assignment submission page like this one for each course, but only one submission form needs to be submitted for each type of assignment.

instructionsP2.part1: Please select the form below for the type of assignment you are submitting. Then use the form to upload one document for each course you are taking which requires that assignment.
instructionsP2.part2: and then upload four documents on it: one for Intro to Law, one for Contracts, one for Criminal Law, and one for Torts.

definitions.title: Definitions Submission Form
definitions.description: Submit definitions for legal terms and concepts

caseBriefs.title: Case Briefs Submission Form
caseBriefs.description: Submit case briefs and legal analysis

miniThesis.title: Mini Thesis Papers Submission Form
miniThesis.description: Submit mini thesis papers and research

importantNotesList: Each assignment type requires a separate submission form
You can upload multiple course documents on a single form
Make sure to include your name and course information on each document
Submit assignments before the deadline to avoid late penalties
Contact your instructor if you have questions about specific assignments

caseBriefs.title: Case Briefs Submission Form
caseBriefs.subtitle: Submit case briefs and legal analysis
caseBriefs.instructionsP1: This form allows you to submit case briefs for multiple courses. For each course, provide the course information and detailed case briefs including facts, issues, holdings, and reasoning.
caseBriefs.instructionsP2: Each case brief should include all required sections. You can add multiple courses and multiple case briefs per course. Make sure all required fields are completed before submission.

placeholders.caseName: e.g., Brown v. Board of Education
placeholders.facts: Summarize the key facts of the case...
placeholders.issue: What legal question is the court addressing?
placeholders.reasoning: Explain the court's legal reasoning and analysis...
placeholders.significance: What is the broader impact of this decision?

midtermEssays.title: Midterm Essay Exams Submission Form
midtermEssays.subtitle: Submit midterm essay examinations
midtermEssays.instructionsP1: This form allows you to submit midterm essay exams for multiple courses. Each exam should include the exam details, essay questions, and your written responses. Make sure to include word counts and time spent on each question.
midtermEssays.instructionsP2: Each essay question should be answered thoroughly and demonstrate your understanding of the course material. You can add multiple courses and multiple essay questions per course.
importantNoticeList: Ensure all essay questions are answered completely and thoroughly
Include relevant legal citations and case law references where applicable
Submit before the deadline to avoid late penalties
Double-check your answers for accuracy and completeness
Contact your instructor immediately if you encounter technical issues

placeholders.questionText: Copy the essay question from your exam...
placeholders.answer: Write your comprehensive answer to the essay question. Include relevant legal principles, case law, and analysis...

miniThesis.title: Mini Thesis Papers Submission Form
miniThesis.subtitle: Submit mini thesis papers and research assignments
miniThesis.instructionsP1: This form allows you to submit mini thesis papers for multiple courses. Each thesis should include a clear research question, methodology, findings, and conclusion. Follow academic writing standards and include proper citations.
miniThesis.instructionsP2: Each thesis paper should be well-structured and demonstrate critical thinking. You can add multiple courses and multiple thesis papers per course. Make sure all required fields are completed.

placeholders.title: Enter the title of your thesis
placeholders.topic: e.g., Freedom of Speech in Digital Age
placeholders.keywords: e.g., freedom of speech, digital rights, constitutional law
placeholders.abstract: Provide a concise summary of your research question, methodology, and key findings...
placeholders.introduction: Introduce your research question, provide context, and outline your argument...
placeholders.literatureReview: Review relevant literature and establish the context for your research...
placeholders.methodology: Describe your research methods, data collection, and analysis approach...
placeholders.findings: Present your research findings and analysis...
placeholders.conclusion: Summarize your findings, discuss implications, and suggest future research...
placeholders.references: List all sources cited in your thesis (use appropriate citation format)...

chatResponses.courseSummary:
Here's a comprehensive summary of your course topic:

**Key Concepts:**
â€¢ Fundamental principles and theories
â€¢ Core methodologies and approaches
â€¢ Essential frameworks and models

**Main Points:**
â€¢ Critical learning objectives
â€¢ Important definitions and terminology
â€¢ Key relationships between concepts

**Important Details:**
â€¢ Practical applications and examples
â€¢ Common challenges and solutions
â€¢ Best practices and recommendations

This summary covers the essential aspects of your course material. Would you like me to elaborate on any specific topic?
chatResponses.studyTips:
Here are personalized study strategies for your subject:

**Active Learning Techniques:**
â€¢ Create mind maps and concept diagrams
â€¢ Use the Feynman technique (explain to others)
â€¢ Practice with flashcards and spaced repetition

**Time Management:**
â€¢ Use the Pomodoro technique (25-min focused sessions)
â€¢ Schedule regular review sessions
â€¢ Break complex topics into smaller chunks

**Memory Enhancement:**
â€¢ Connect new information to existing knowledge
â€¢ Use mnemonic devices and acronyms
â€¢ Practice retrieval through self-quizzing

**Environment Optimization:**
â€¢ Find a quiet, distraction-free study space
â€¢ Use consistent study times
â€¢ Take regular breaks to maintain focus
chatResponses.practiceQuestions:
Here are Python programming practice questions to test your understanding:

**Multiple Choice Questions:**
1. What is the output of `print(type([]))`?
   A) <class 'list'>
   B) <class 'array'>
   C) <class 'sequence'>
   D) <class 'collection'>

2. Which method is used to add an element to the end of a list?
   A) list.insert()
   B) list.append()
   C) list.add()
   D) list.push()

**Code Analysis Questions:**
3. What will this code output?
```python
x = [1, 2, 3]
y = x
y.append(4)
print(x)
```

4. Explain the difference between `==` and `is` in Python.

**Problem-Solving Questions:**
5. Write a function that finds the second largest number in a list.

6. Create a program that counts the frequency of each character in a string.

7. Implement a function to check if a string is a palindrome.

**Debugging Questions:**
8. Find and fix the bug in this code:
```python
def calculate_average(numbers):
    total = 0
    for num in numbers:
        total += num
    return total / len(numbers)

result = calculate_average([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
print(result)
```

**Concept Questions:**
9. Explain the difference between a tuple and a list in Python.

10. What are list comprehensions and provide an example?

**Advanced Questions:**
11. Write a decorator that measures the execution time of a function.

12. Explain the concept of generators and create a simple generator function.

Would you like me to provide the answers or create more specific questions for your Python topic?
chatResponses.default: I understand you're asking about your studies. I'm here to help with course summaries, study tips, practice questions, and general academic support. Could you please be more specific about what you need help with?

sort.desc: Sort messages by newest or oldest first to organize your conversations chronologically.

studentsList.title: Students List
studentsList.desc: Browse all your students with unread message indicators. Click on any student to start or continue a conversation.

chatHeader.title: Chat Header
chatHeader.desc: View the selected student's information and course details in the chat header.

chatArea.title: Message History
chatArea.desc: View the complete conversation history with the selected student. Messages are color-coded: blue for sent, white for received.

input.title: Message Input
input.desc: Type your message here and press Enter or click Send to communicate with the selected student.

header.title: Events Overview
header.desc: Welcome to the Events page. Here you can view and manage all your scheduled events, lectures, and activities.

search.title: Search Events
search.desc: Quickly find specific events by typing the event title, course, or description.

filter.title: Filter Events
filter.desc: Filter events by type: lectures, labs, meetings, office hours, and more.

viewToggle.title: View Options
viewToggle.desc: Switch between grid view (cards) and list view (table) to see events in different layouts.

grid.title: Events Display
grid.desc: Each event card shows details like time, location, attendees, and type. Click on events to navigate to related pages.

header.title: Analytics Insights
header.desc: Welcome to the Insights page. Here you can analyze your teaching performance, student engagement, and course metrics.

metricSelector.title: Select Metrics
metricSelector.desc: Choose which metric to analyze: course performance, student engagement, time spent, or progress tracking.

timeRange.title: Time Range
timeRange.desc: Select the time period for your analysis: last 7 days, last semester, or last year.

chart.title: Data Visualization
chart.desc: View your selected metrics in an interactive chart. Hover over data points to see detailed values.

metrics.title: Key Metrics
metrics.desc: Review important statistics like average, maximum, minimum values, and trend analysis for your selected metric.

header.title: Grades Management
header.desc: Welcome to your grades management page. Here you can review, edit, and manage student grades across all your courses.

courseSelector.title: Course Selection
courseSelector.desc: Select the course you want to manage grades for. Each course shows different students and their assignment scores.

table.title: Grades Overview
table.desc: Review and edit final grades and feedback. Each row shows a student with their assignment scores and final grade.

edit.title: Edit Grades
edit.desc: Click the edit button to modify student grades and add feedback. This opens a detailed grade management modal.

message.title: Student Communication
message.desc: Click the message button to send direct messages to students about their grades, feedback, or any other academic matters.

header.title: Course Materials Management
header.desc: Welcome to your course materials management page. Here you can upload, organize, and manage all your course resources.

search.title: Search Materials
search.desc: Quickly find specific materials by typing the title, file name, or type.

viewToggle.title: View Options
viewToggle.desc: Switch between grid view (cards) and list view (table) to see your materials in different layouts.

upload.title: Upload Materials
upload.desc: Add new PDFs, quizzes, or resources for your course.

list.title: Materials Library
list.desc: Manage uploaded files and edit details.

header.title: Notifications Management
header.desc: Welcome to your notifications management page. Create and manage announcements for your students with different priorities and target audiences.

new.title: Create New Notification
new.desc: Click this button to create a new announcement or notification for your students.

search.title: Search Notifications
search.desc: Quickly find specific notifications by typing the title or message content.

filter.title: Filter by Type
filter.desc: Filter notifications by type: schedule, exam, assignment, material, feedback, or general announcements.

sort.title: Sort Notifications
sort.desc: Sort notifications by newest or oldest first to organize your announcements chronologically.

viewToggle.title: View Options
viewToggle.desc: Switch between grid view (cards) and list view (table) to see your notifications in different layouts.

list.title: Notifications List
list.desc: View all your notifications with priority indicators, timestamps, and target audience information. Click on any notification to edit or delete it.

actions.title: Notification Actions
actions.desc: Edit or delete notifications using the action buttons. Each notification shows its type, priority level, and target audience.

actions.title: Profile & Actions
actions.desc: Update details, change password, and access quick links.

complete.title: Instructor Onboarding Tour Complete!
complete.desc: You have completed the instructor tour and explored the key teaching features. You're ready to go!

drop.chooseOrDrag: Choose a file or drag it here

uploadModal.title: Upload Students
uploadModal.chooseOrDrag: Choose a file or drag it here

messages.noValidData: No valid data found in the file
messages.processingError: Error processing the file. Please check the format.

deleteModal.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete {{name}}? This action cannot be undone.

credentialsModal.title: Create Credentials
credentialsModal.requireChange: Require password change on first login

compliance.title: Compliance Checklist
compliance.intro: Marln LMS is committed to full compliance with all relevant data protection laws and best practices. We regularly review and update our policies to ensure ongoing alignment.

pdpl.label: Saudi Arabia PDPL (Personal Data Protection Law)

header.title: Data Retention Policy
header.subtitle: How we manage and retain your data in Marln LMS

info.text: This page summarizes how user and course data is retained and managed in compliance with legal obligations (GDPR). For questions, contact your administrator.

lawful.desc: Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject
Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject

legal.title: Legal Alignment: Saudi Arabia's PDPL & Shariah Principles
legal.intro: Marln LMS aligns with international and local data protection standards. Below is a mapping of Saudi Arabia's Personal Data Protection Law (PDPL) principles to corresponding Shariah concepts, ensuring both legal and cultural compliance.
legal.note: Note: The PDPL (2021, amended 2023) is Saudi Arabia's primary data protection law. Its principles are designed to be compatible with Shariah, ensuring both legal and ethical data stewardship in Marln LMS.

unauthorized.title: Access Denied
unauthorized.subtitle: You don't have permission to access this page

alert.title: Why am I seeing this?
alert.message: This page requires specific permissions or a different user role. Please contact your administrator if you believe this is an error.

unauthorized.help: Need help? Contact support at support@university.edu

upsell.title: Upgrade to PRO
upsell.desc: Get unlimited AI insights and advanced analytics

welcome.title: How can I help you today?
welcome.subtitle: I'm here to assist with your studies and academic needs.

courseSummary.title: Course Summary
courseSummary.description: Get a comprehensive summary of any course topic

studyTips.title: Study Tips
studyTips.description: Receive personalized study strategies and tips

practiceQuestions.title: Practice Questions

progressInsight.excellent: Strong academic performance with consistent progress
progressInsight.good: Good progress with room for improvement

attendanceInsight.acceptable: Attendance is acceptable but could improve

engagementInsight.active: Student is actively engaged with course materials

progress.low: Schedule individual meeting to discuss academic challenges and create improvement plan
progress.high: Maintain current support level and encourage continued excellence

attendance.low: Send personalized attendance reminder and offer additional support resources
attendance.high: Acknowledge good attendance and encourage continued participation

engagement.low: Reach out via message to check on student engagement and offer assistance
engagement.high: Continue monitoring engagement and provide positive reinforcement

progress.low: Target specific weak areas in upcoming assignments
progress.high: Challenge with advanced topics to maintain engagement

attendance.low: Implement attendance tracking and follow-up system
attendance.high: Encourage leadership in class discussions and group activities

focusAreas.feedback: Provide timely feedback on all submitted work to maintain momentum
